title: How do directors actually direct movies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tricky question! Not sure what the question applies to or what the question refers to. Most directors gets chosen to direct a movie. Sometimes they chose to direct a movie by reading a script. Then when they direct they instruct the actors how to react in certain sccenes. A director is basically the main guy when forming the movie. He often works with the composer, editor and cinematographer to decide on the visual style of the movie. A movie is often a director’s vision. So he directs based on how the director sees the movie. He or she instructs the actors how to act and then chooses the best take to be in the movie.
The director is the tastemaker. When you direct a movie, everyone else asks your opinion about how they should be doing their job. And typically your word is law.
